title: Ticket #1074: Eval Behavior Testing Frameworks & Unit Testing Frameworks
description:
As part of the Build->Packaging->Test work, it seems worth while to evaluate existing scripting test frameworks, b/c the existing system has severe limitations.

A perquisite may be to execute the existing tests using new framework.

Links:

    • http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Behavior_Driven_Development
remarks:
2010-Jan-15 12:59:49 by tstclair:
read through behavior testing vs. unit testing, and I'm left feeling that some hybrid is what flips the bill.

The nice feature of many unit-testing tools is the runner. If we create a setup & teardown f(n) that guarantee each instance of condor is isolated, we could support parallel & selective testing as well as grouping.

e.g. we could run select "tools" tests in parallel, and deselect "soap" tests.

Using well established tools and techniques would help a lot in reducing latency in testing.
